RTCRtpTransceiverCurrentDirection.summary: The read-only property currentDirection is a string which indicates the current negotiated directionality of the transceiver.

remarks.para: The directionality indicates whether the transceiver will offer to send and/or receive RTP data, or whether it is inactive or stopped and won't send or receive data.

The transceiver's preferred directionality can be set and read using the property.
Changing the direction triggers a renegotiation, which may eventually result in the currentDirection also changing.

RTCRtpTransceiverCurrentDirection.value: The value is initially null, prior to negotiation using an offer/answer.After negotiation the value is a string with one of the following values:
